availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of James Lobb and Lenorah Lobb. Married to Sarah Crail Lobb in Green County, Kentucky, on September 3, 1863. Father of Elzada Lobb. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 8, 1861, to June 9, 1863. Wounded at the Battle of Stones River, Rutherford County, Tennessee, December 31, 1862. Discharged on account of disability on June 9, 1863.

ab.bibl:
